title: (x) @typeid from @chrissyjensen
content: Love some help IDing font in The Fortune Cookie titles: [http://ow.ly/i/gMz](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012153845/http:/ow.ly/i/gMz "http://ow.ly/i/gMz")
author: typeid

comments.content: This is likely custom lettering, not a font. [Wendy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012153845/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/letter_perfect/wendy_bold_ot/?&sample_text=The%20Fortune%20Cookie&sample_size=48) will get you close.

These are not exact, but capture some of the same spirit as your sample:

[Brody OT](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012153845/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsnerflake/brody_ot/?&sample_text=The%20Fortune%20Cookie&sample_size=74)

[Freestyle Script Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012153845/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsnerflake/freestyle_script_bold/?&sample_text=The%20Fortune%20Cookie&sample_size=74)

[La Salle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012153845/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsnerflake/lasalle/?&sample_text=The%20Fortune%20Cookie&sample_size=60)

[Bistro Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012153845/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/suitcase/bistro-script/)
